text.content:
Play at the beginning of your turn while you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}.

As you wander the limbo between life and death, you're tempted by a trickster with a true heroic recovery. Your recovery check uses the following results instead.

Critical Success You regain a number of Hit Points equal to @Damage[(2*@actor.level)[healing]]{twice your level}, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for this turn, and can take your actions immediately. The extra action must be used to perform a basic move action, or Interact to pick up or draw an item.

Success As success, but the Hit Points you regain are equal to @Damage[(@actor.level)[healing]]{your level}.

Failure You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Critical Failure You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Play when you succeed a saving throw that an ally just failed.

You daydream for a moment what you would do in your ally's predicament, and that dream becomes reality! You swap your natural result on the d20 with your ally's, potentially changing both of your results.

Play when you critically hit an enemy or exploit an enemy's weakness.

You give your ally an opportunity to follow up your assault! Choose an ally who is able to act. Their initiative position is moved to directly after you. Your turn ends, and you grant that ally a circumstance bonus to a check of their choice equal to 1 + the number of actions you had left. This bonus lasts until the end of their turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.ouNWLIg54qdlsaeZ]{Effect: Baton Pass}

Play when you critically hit an enemy or exploit an enemy's weakness.

The enemy reels from the impact, giving you a window to act. You gain an additional action that can be used to used to Strike, use a move action, or an Interact action. The triggering weakness, if any, cannot be exploited again this turn.

Play when a conscious ally within your Speed becomes inflicted with a harmful condition.

You Stride to a space adjacent to that ally, slapping them across the face, shaking both their shoulders, or just giving them a piece of your mind. You attempt to counteract the triggering condition using an unarmed attack roll, or a skill check at the GM's discretion, such as Diplomacy to rally them up, or Religion to pray to your deity.

Your counteract rank is half your level rounded up.

Special You can use this card while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming if you have the corresponding movement type.

Play during your turn while you're able to use manipulate actions.

By planning ahead, you're able to have the right item at the right time. You can Interact to draw a consumable item from your or your allies' inventories as though it were on your own.

Play when roll damage as a result of a critical success of yours, or an enemies' critical failure.

You push yourself to inflict even more punishment onto your foe, at the expense of your own safety. You can roll damage again and use the higher of the two results. If you use the new roll, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round as a result of this reckless maneuver.

Play when an enemy is about to take their turn directly before yours.

With a sudden rush of energy, you cut ahead of your foe. You take your turn before the triggering enemy, moving your initiative position accordingly. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} at the end of your turn from this overexertion.

Play when the trigger for one of your reactions is met.

You quickly seize an opportunity to intervene. You can use the triggering reaction as a free action instead. As normal, you can use only action in response to a given trigger.

Play during your turn while you can use manipulate actions, and you haven't played this card since the last time you were able to purchase goods.

You can produce an item as a 2-action activity to remove your backpack and draw the item as though you had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.bh2jHyyYrkLMsIdX]{Prescient Planner} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lHFz4MmebvPqTb0A]{Prescient Consumable} feats, paying the costs as normal.

If you already have Prescient Planner, you can play this card even if you have used the feat since you last were able to purchase goods.

Play during your turn while you have at least one spell slot left.

You reshape the energy harnessed for your spell at the last second. For the next spell you Cast this turn using a spell slot, select a common spell of the same tradition, and of the same rank or lower. You Cast that Spell instead.

After Casting the Spell, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round, as your brain is scrambled by a strange magical feedback.

Play at the start of your turn.

You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.m0f2B7G9eaaTmhFL]{Devise a Stratagem}. If you don't already have Devise a Stratagem, you can't use Intelligence instead of your usual modifier when substituting the result of your attack roll, and you can only use an attack stratagem.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.4xFVJqqB3aPpnTQp]{Effect: Advanced Strategy}

Special If you already have Devise a Stratagem, you can play this card to reroll the result of your d20 when using that ability, ignoring the usual restriction from the fortune trait. You must keep the new result.

Play during your turn.

You attempt to Tumble Through a creature of your size or larger. If you critically succeed, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, as you swiftly sweep them off the ground with your slide.

Play when an encounter breaks out while you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kV3XM0YJeS2KCSOb]{Scouting}.

With a quick command, you and your party get into a planned formation. You and all your allies gain their reaction, even if they normally wouldn't due to not having acted yet, and can choose to use that reaction immediately to perform a single Interact or move action.

Play when an encounter breaks out while you were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EwgTZBWsc8qKaViP]{Investigating}.

You can Recall Knowledge. In addition to answering your question, the GM gives you one piece of information they deem instrumental to succeed in this encounter.

Play when an enemy critically succeeds a saving throw, or an attack roll.

Your foe's overconfidence allows you to exploit an opening. The enemy must reroll the triggering check and use the new result. If the result is a critical failure, it becomes a failure instead.

Play when an enemy Casts a Spell, you have a reaction, and at least one spell slot available.

You spend a spell slot and as a reaction you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.E4Q7EiSG18sIvFwg]{Counteract} the triggering spell, using the rank of your spent spell slot as your counteract rank. This effect has the trait corresponding to the tradition of the spell slot used.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.EpBG4CFMNSZQx7vI]{Counterspell} feat, your counteract rank for this effect counts as one higher.

Play at the start of your turn.

Be it the guidance of a deity, a strong gut feeling, or a vision from beyond, you gain a glimpse into the near future. You gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} in relation to a particular course of action up to 1 minute into the future. The GM doesn't roll the usual flat check, as this glimpse is close enough to the present.

Play when you roll a natural 1 on any check during an encounter.

You willingly accept an otherworldly curse offered by an agent of chaos witnessing your battle. The triggering result becomes a natural 20 instead. However, the next natural 20 you roll in an encounter becomes a natural 1, which you must keep.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.IAqtfUOSpLVDZpMC]{Effect: Curse of Temporal Discounting}

Play at the start of your turn.

You close your eyes and focus on your other senses. For 1 round, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, but you gain a precise sense between echolocation, tremorsense or wavesense, each with a range of 60 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.hjPthRPNiLM49yc2]{Effect: Instinctual Senses}

Play when you use a spell or impulse that has an area of effect.

You spread your energy over a wider region. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.FoWO4RnHRwfEIC7Q]{Widen Spell} spellshape with its usual action cost.

Special If you already have Widen Spell you can instead play this card to use it as a free action.

Play when you use a spell or impulse with a range.

You stretch your energy to reach beyond its usual horizon. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BWomK7EVY0WXxWgh]{Reach Spell} spellshape with its usual action cost.

Special If you already have Reach Spell you can instead play this card to use it as a free action.

Play at the start of your turn.

Until the end of your next turn, you can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while you're conscious. Additionally, your movement or manipulate actions do not trigger reactions.

Play when you Cast a Spell with a saving throw and a specific number of targets on your turn.

You dangerously harness more energy into your spell. You can increase the number of actions required for the spell by one. If you do, you add one additional target, but their degree of success against the spell improves by one step.

Play when you take physical damage from a critically successful melee Strike.

Despite your pain, you don't lose focus and immediately make the best out of a terrible situation. If the triggering damage would knock you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, you remain at 1 HP instead and your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} value increases by 1.

The triggering enemy receives a penalty depending on the type of damage dealt by its Strike. If there are multiple applicable damage types, choose one.

  • Bludgeoning The enemy overcommits to its attack and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
  • Piercing As you are pierced, you push through the pain and use it as an opportunity to keep your foe in place. The enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by you, even if you don't have a free hand, until the end of your next turn or until it Escapes.
  • Slashing Your attacker's viciousness backfires, and the resulting blood splatter hits its eyes. The enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until it uses a manipulate action to clear its eyes.

Play when you would roll a Diplomacy check.

You automatically receive a result of 20 + your Diplomacy modifier on your check instead of rolling. Unlike a natural 20, this does not increase your degree of success, unless the result exceeds the DC by 10 or more.

Play at the start of your turn in an encounter where you used Stealth for initiative

You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} until the end of your turn. You can use the extra action only to Hide, Sneak, or Take Cover.

Play when an ally is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by an enemy, and you are within reach of both.

Make a Strike against the triggering enemy. On a hit, your ally loses the condition as if they successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escaped}. For the purposes of this effect, an ally that has been @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallowed Whole} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} is within reach.

Play when an ally is targeted with an enemy's ability for which you would be a valid target.

You use a pointed insult, feign an opening, or otherwise make yourself an easy target. You become the target instead of your ally.

Play when you hit, but not critically hit, an enemy with a Strike.

You benefit from your weapon or unarmed attack's critical specialization effect, as well the additional effect as though you had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qUnDHEXteUQGE8yp]{Grievous} rune.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.mcb5Rie1D4QG3LGk]{Effect: Weapon Specialist}

Play during exploration.

Choose an ally at least trained in Stealth for you and your other allies to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, as though they had the Quiet Allies feat, and were an expert in Stealth if they are only trained.

If the chosen ally already has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.pekKtubQTkG9m1xK]{Quiet Allies} feat, they can use their own modifier for the single Stealth check instead of using the lowest modifier. As usual for Quiet Allies, this doesn't apply to initiative rolls.

Play when you are adjacent to an ally and you have at least one hand free.

You simply must toss them. You pick up that ally and make an Athletics check. You toss them to an unoccupied space you can see that is within the result of your check in feet, rounded down to the nearest 5 foot increment.

Special If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.V9kShXu84NlORfcg]{Friendly Toss} or another similar feat, the card allows you to use that instead (at no action cost, as usual for Hero Point cards).

Play when an ally you can see would be reduced to 0 Hit Points by an effect targeted at them.

Time slows down for you as you see your ally in mortal danger. You Stride toward the triggering ally. If you are adjacent to them at the end of this movement, you receive all the damage from the triggering effect instead. This damage can't be reduced in any way.

Special You can Fly, Swim or Climb instead if you have the corresponding speed.

Play when an ally is about to use an action that could benefit from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid}.

You can use the Aid reaction even if you haven't prepared to help. You must still fulfill the other requirements to Aid, such as determining how you are helping and being in a position to do so.

Special You can play this card if you were already able to Aid to increase the degree of success of your Aid check instead.

Play at the start of your turn.

You suddenly hasten your movements. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for this turn and can use the extra action to Interact, Strike, or take a single action with the move trait. At the end of your turn, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Slowed 1} for 1 round, as you are forced to briefly catch your breath after.

Play during your turn.

You employ an obscure thaumaturgic symbol on your weapon or across your arm, invoking the ability to potentially exploit a weakness. Until the end of your next turn, your Strikes and spells deals 1 additional damage of an energy damage type of your choice. If you worship a deity, they can instead gain a trait allowed by its divine sanctification.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-hero-point-deck-expansion.hero-point-deck-expansion-effects.Item.CFiEvZUKBEwDr3zV]{Effect: Symbolic Rites}
